openxlsx 4.1.3.9005
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Load an existing .xlsx file

Source: R/loadWorkbook.R
loadWorkbook.Rd

loadWorkbook returns a workbook object conserving styles and formatting of the original .xlsx file.

loadWorkbook(file, xlsxFile = NULL, isUnzipped = FALSE)

Arguments

file

A path to an existing .xlsx or .xlsm file
xlsxFile

alias for file
isUnzipped

Set to TRUE if the xlsx file is already unzipped

Value

Workbook object.

See also

removeWorksheet

Examples

## load existing workbook from package folder
wb <- loadWorkbook(file = system.file("extdata","loadExample.xlsx", package= "openxlsx"))
names(wb)  #list worksheets
#> [1] "IrisSample"   "testing"      "mtcars"       "mtCars Pivot"
wb ## view object
#> A Workbook object.
#>  
#> Worksheets:
#>  Sheet 1: "IrisSample"
#>  
#> 	Custom row heights (row: height)
#> 	 1: 34.5 
#> 	Custom column widths (column: width)
#> 	  1: 10.86, 2: 10.43, 3: 10.86, 4: 10.43, 5: 13.14, 7: 12.43, 8: 18.43, 9: 18.00, 10: 18.14, 11: 17.71, 12: 9.715 
#>  
#> 
#>  Sheet 2: "testing"
#>  
#> 	Custom row heights (row: height)
#> 	 7: 24, 8: 15.75, 20: 15.75, 27: 15.75, 28: 15.75, 29: 16.5, 31: 15.75, 33: 15.75, 35: 15.75, 36: 16.5, 37: 15.75, 38: 15.75 
#> 	Custom column widths (column: width)
#> 	  9: 13.00, 10: 13.00, 11: 13.00, 12: 13.00, 13: 13.00, 14: 13.00 
#>  
#> 
#>  Sheet 3: "mtcars"
#>  
#> 
#>  Sheet 4: "mtCars Pivot"

#> 	  1: 12.43, 2: 14.29, 3: 8.860, 4: 9.145, 5: 9.145 
#>  
#> 
#>  
#>  
#> Images:
#>  Image 1: "/tmp/RtmpBRT0hN//file119067f858fa_openxlsx_loadWorkbook/xl/media/image2.jpeg"
#>  Image 2: "/tmp/RtmpBRT0hN//file119067f858fa_openxlsx_loadWorkbook/xl/media/image1.jpeg"
#>  
#> Charts:
#>  Chart 1: "/tmp/RtmpBRT0hN//file119067f858fa_openxlsx_loadWorkbook/xl/charts/colors2.xml"
#>  Chart 2: "/tmp/RtmpBRT0hN//file119067f858fa_openxlsx_loadWorkbook/xl/charts/style2.xml"
#>  Chart 3: "/tmp/RtmpBRT0hN//file119067f858fa_openxlsx_loadWorkbook/xl/charts/chart2.xml"
#>  Chart 4: "/tmp/RtmpBRT0hN//file119067f858fa_openxlsx_loadWorkbook/xl/charts/chart1.xml"

#>  Chart 8: "/tmp/RtmpBRT0hN//file119067f858fa_openxlsx_loadWorkbook/xl/charts/_rels/chart1.xml.rels"
#>  Worksheet write order: 1, 2, 3, 4
## Add a worksheet
addWorksheet(wb, "A new worksheet")

## Save workbook
if (FALSE) saveWorkbook(wb, "loadExample.xlsx", overwrite = TRUE)
